dialogues.text: . after just 14 days in the famous Meltaweigh. The word "Meltaweigh" appears, superimposed over the slender woman in a space-~suit-like contraption hooked to a vacuum cleaner.

dialogues.speaker: TV ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Guaranteed to take off a minimum of two pounds a week, or your money back. (voice changed for disclaimer) Manufacturer's diet must be followed to take advantage of this offer. The words move up the screen and the phone number "555-THIN appears under it. WIDEN THE SHOT and we're in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicky, slender and cute in her blue jeans, cleans up three breakfast servings and stares at the small countertop TV, only half listening.

dialogues.speaker: TV ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Call 555-THIN and ask for Meltaweigh. It gets to Vicky now, and she switches the channel... to a picture of a rich chocolate cake.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ’ Professional? No, yours? You can make this cake right in your own kitchen! The Woman Announcer is on camera now -- slender, beautiful, and cutting herself a piece of the cake, as:

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN ANNOUNCER VICKY
dialogues.text: Your husband and children will (looking to adore you when you present them the phone) with this moist, rich taste. Ring, damn you! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cc)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS, and Vicky jumps, as if she'd really made it happen. She turns OFF the TV and runs for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Hello? (disappointed) Oh, Mike... No, I didn’t mean 'Oh, Mike,' I meant, I thought it was Frank Lesser... He will, too, call me... No, not for a date! TI mean not only for a date!l... Well, then I'll go over there... Uh, tomorrow. Tf he doesn't call today, I'll go -- The DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) My doorbell's ringing... No, I don't think Frank would come over here... I'm expecting Joyce. The DOORBELL RINGS again, more insistently.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Mike, I have to go to the door... I can't go out with you, I have to wait for his call... The DOORBELL RINGS nonstop.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) I have to go, Mike... Well, maybe he would call if you wouldn't tie up the phone!... No, Mike, wait, I didn't mean -- She reacts to the phone being hung up on-her. Then hangs up and runs out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the front door. Joyce, half-unconscious, leans on the doorbell. Vicky opens the door and Joyce almost falls into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Vicky... help me... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ~~ Vicky, holding her, is horrified. FREEZE on them. — FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce is unconscious, hooked up to life supports. Though she can't hear him, Ben talks to her gently, as he holds her hand, and the tears run down his face.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: I didn't fail in love with a size ll... I didn't fall in love with you when you were skinny... why'd you think?... Why didn't you tell me what...? I would have .. Joyce... don't die... During this we PULL BACK from them, and realize that Vicky is in the room, sitting, numbly, and watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded by bustling activity and noise, Vicky and Ben enter and get into line as:

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (taking coffee for both of them) And she didn't take the lab tests? Or the supplements for the liquid protein?

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (shakes head, no) Just appetite depressants, tranquilizers, uppers, downers, who the hell knows what... and all for a dammed dress size!... It's not worth it, Vicky! We don't all have to look like sticks!

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: But you were losing weight, Ben. And she was afraid you would find someone else... someone... slender. They're now at the desserts.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: That's... crazy... (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's... I love Joyce... I love her!... It's... It's crazy! (glaring at the rich desserts) Everyone's throwing food at us... and then, they're saying we ean't eat it!... It's on television, it's in the papers, it's on the billboards... It's in the damned restaurants... They're shoving the calories at you, and they're saying come on in, and eat those gigantic plates full of stuff... But!... But you'd better be skinny when you're doing it, or you won't be able to buy clothes you can wear while you're doing it! Half-crazed with worry and anger, now, he suddenly grabs at a piece of cream pie... doesn't know what to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well... if that's what they want... He suddenly puts the pie on his tray and begins to grab more pie, and cake, and ice cream, and every no-no he can see, and pile them in a precarious tower on his tray, as:

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: (continuing) If that's what they want... then let's do it... let's eat it all .. this is for us, Vicky... for you and for me... and for Joyce... In a final burst of frustration, Ben sweeps his arm — across the tray knocking the tower of desserts in all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sterile, cold room, with hard chairs. A window looks out on a parking lot and a billboard of a bikinied beauty standing in front of a low slung sports car. Patty and Marge stand at the window staring out. Vicky sits alone in a corner, deep in her own thoughts.  ”

dialogues.speaker: MARGE AND PATTY 109
dialogues.text: Gesturing

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: Eventually he would have, you know... left her for a slim young chick.

dialogues.speaker: MARGE
dialogues.text: He's not like that.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: They're all like that.

dialogues.speaker: MARGE
dialogues.text: Well... if that's what he wants, she's better off without him.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: . or dead...

dialogues.speaker: MARGE
dialogues.text: (angry, but with ! compassion) Patty, you and Vicky and Joyce and... everyone... you can't buy that dumb hoopla... I'd blow up to 400 pounds before I did that to myself. vaguely toward where Joyce might be.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: You just don't care how you look.

dialogues.speaker: MARGE
dialogues.text: And you don't care about anything else!. There's a lot more to life than wearing a size 9!

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: But you don't get it unless you are!... Size 9... and wrinkle- proof. Marge walks away from that and goes to Vicki. Vicky, deep in thought, doesn’t acknowledge her.

dialogues.speaker: MARGE
dialogues.text: If you're sitting there blaming yourself --

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I made her start dieting... she didn't want to. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ao

dialogues.speaker: MARGE
dialogues.text: You didn't turn her into a liquid protein junky. She did that herself. Patty joins them, as:

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I've been trying to strike a bargain... with someone... God, maybe... that if Joyce could live . I'd offer to gain all the weight back again.

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: You don't have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (more guilty) I can't... I tried to promise... but I can't do it... I'm so... selfish...

dialogues.speaker: PATTY
dialogues.text: Vicky, you earned the right to take care of yourself =~ Don't blow it now. Vicky has a moment to think about that, then Ben appears at the door. Worn out, unshaven... Vicky sees him first. She stands, afraid.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Ben. ..? At beat... Ben manages a small grin... and puts his hands up in a winner's gesture. And everyone relaxes, gathers around him, and hugs him, Vicky sobbing in re- lief. All AD LIBBING questions, assurances that they always knew she'd pull through, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large room, filled with artists at drawing tables, office workers... a refreshment cart with soft drinks and doughnuts... NOISE... work. In a sharp business outfit and looking terrific, Vicky somes in from a corridor, looks about, and we PAN the room, her POV . until we FIND a glassed off partition in one cor- mer. Frank works in there. We APPROACH it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank works at a large desk. There's a couch across the room. Vicky can be SEEN outside, knocking. And we HEAR the KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (without looking up) Come in. Vicky opens the door, stands in the doorway a moment, and waits. Frank looks up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Yes?... Oh... Eric's most brilliant student, right? Vicky grins, shrugs, nods. Frank, very interested now, goes to the door to lead her in, and close the door, and the NOISE OUT. He gestures her to the couch and they both sit, as:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hownice of you to drop by.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't just drop by... you did say... there was going to be an opening.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Have you done something to yourself since I last saw you?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: ... Put on a dress... took off a few pounds...°

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well, you look wonderful! You'll be a pretty addition to the office.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Then I do have a job?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (moving closer) Well... let's talk about it. (takes her hand) I think we're going to be great friends. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cc) a)

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: . When can I start?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You're divorced, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Getting.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Nice. If it's what you want.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (carefully) What I want... is a job. (takes her hand out of his) Just a job. And she looks at him, questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bed is up. Mike works at an easel, as Vicky opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Let's celebrate! She slams the door hard. And the bed doesn't fall. Both notice it briefly, as Mike comes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Okay, let's celebrate. (hits the wall, no bed) Celebrate what?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I got the job. She puts her purse and jacket down and slams the door again.. No bed.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You went to his office?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Yep. And I start tomorrow. (goes to pr on the bed What's wrong with this thing? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (losing interest in the bed) What happened there? In his office?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, a little chasing around the desk. (forgets the bed, remembering delightedly) I, Vicky Matthews, was actually chased around the desk. Isn't that great?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Did he catch you?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Of course not. But he chased me! (goes back to working on the bed) What'd you do to this thing?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It doesn't come down if the vibes aren't right.

dialogues.speaker: . VICKY
dialogues.text: Mike, be proud of me! I came out of my refrigerator and I got a job!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: It'll be two jobs... one in his office... and one in his bed. You can't handle that. A beat; they're both growing more angry and upset.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh, Mike... don't...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: You really think he needs an apprentice?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Mike... don't pull a Jack on me : Don't tell me how to run my life... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MIKE -
dialogues.text: Vicky, you don't know what's happening out there! A beat. Vicky picks up her purse and jacket.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: (continuing) Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (on her way out the door) On with my life.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: What? He goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I'm going on with my life... My life, Mike... not yours... (kisses him gently) Goodbye. She goes, closes the door, just normally. And the bed falls. And Mike is in the room alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen's and Jack's cars are parked side by side in the driveway, as Vicky's car comes down the street... hesi- tates at the filled driveway... and then pulls into place at the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack is on the easy chair, looking very much at home. Helen hurries to the door, excitedly, as Vicky enters.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (sotto voce) Jack's here!

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (warily) So I see. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cc)

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (standing at his chair, compassionately) I came over as soon as I heard.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Heard what? Jack looks to Helen, who takes a beat to understand, and then dées. She goes about gathering her purse, jacket, knitting, as:

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: The children were angels, as usual. They went right to bed. It's a good thing Jack came over. I had company. She's at the door now, and near Vicky. And Helen wave, and Vicky.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (continuing ; sotto voce) Whatever is best for you, Vicky. I just want you to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (more sotto voce) But he's not such a terrible man, you know.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (grins, kisses Helen's cheek) Bye, Mom. looks back at Jack for a final smile, and a goes.. As the door closes, Jack goes to

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I was looking for you... at that school... and Mike told me about your job. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (wary) Thank you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cc) c)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She goes to Lisa's door and looks in on her. Jack follows.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You're lucky you're rid of him, Vicky. He's not for you!

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: That must have been some session. She looks in on Danny -- Jack stays with her. -

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: When he told me what happened, I was over here in a flash. Because I know how you get, and I wanted to be here for you.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Oh?... How do I get? She goes into the kitchen. Jack follows.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (as they enter) I know there are times you have to eat, Vick. After all, you need something comforting.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I didn't eat. She starts to prepare tea as:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (almost disappointed) Well... well, that's great... but, I'm just saying, it's all right i

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Don't sabotage me, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Vicky, I love you. I'm trying to tell you that I love you, no matter how fat you are. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (calmly) I'm not fat.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: But if you gain weight --

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I'm not gaining weight.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Good, I know that. I'm just saying --

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (looks for his jacket) I know what you're saying and I don't want to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You're right, you don't need to hear it. Vicky nods her agreement and goes back to her tea. Jack drapes his arms around her. She moves

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (continuing) And you don't need Mike, and you don't need that job either... You need me, Vicky. And from now on, I'm going to be here for you.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (easing out of his arms) I don't need ‘you! so that the table is between. them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I've changed, Vicky. I understand you now. I can help you. You do need me!

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Like I need a hot fudge sundae. She goes into the living room and Jack follows.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE LIVING ROOM 116
dialogues.text: They enter, Vicky finds Jack's jacket, gives it to him and leads him to the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: . VICKY
dialogues.text: — What I need is more time to myself.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (solicitous) You're tired.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: No -- I'm excited, and proud of myself and I want to relish it all alone, At the door:

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm going to treat myself to a long delicious bubble bath.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (coming on) I'll serub your back.

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: I can scrub my own back. I can do anything. (with growing exuberance) Anything!
She opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I'll see you Sunday?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (happily) Right. Getting him out.

dialogues.speaker: , JACK
dialogues.text: Want to go to Disneyland with me and the kids?

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: Maybe. Shutting the door.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: we It’ll be like old times, Vick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VICKY
dialogues.text: (warmly) Good night, Jack. She closes the door and leans on it, thinking. Then she smiles... accepts what she's done... and likes it... And then, gets a new idea. She grabs her purse, and searches in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no cars in the driveway. Vicky's wagon is still at the curb. Vicky rums out of the house, carry- ing her keys. She hops into the wagon, pulls it into the griveway - The garage door goes up. Vicky drives inside, parking in the middle and taking up both sides. The garage door lowers. We HOLD on that. FADE OUT.
